result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Tyrail Deion Redd

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Tyrail Deion Redd in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Tyrail Deion Redd.  Prosecuting attorney Amy E Spanczak for Abby Rockendorf in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Scheduling conference.  Defense has received most discovery and requests adjourned Status conference.  State is ordered to turn over remaining discovery forthwith.  Case adjourned to Br 9.
Status conference scheduled for November 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrail Deion Redd in court.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii in court for Tyrail Deion Redd.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for the State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Arraignment.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pled not guilty as to all counts.
Defense has received discovery and an offer from the State and requests adjourned Scheduling conference. Request granted. Case adjourned to Br 9.
Scheduling conference scheduled for October 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and filed:  Original Transcript of Proceedings commencing 8/16/022 (13 pages) and Certification of Filing Transcript.

Defendant Tyrail Deion Redd in court with attorney S. Sargent covering for William Anthony Rakestraw.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded. Court took judicial notice of case #06CF2228.  Sworn for the State: MCSO Detective J. Guillot.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy and waived reading. Case is adjourned to Branch 09.  Arraignment scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Tyrail Deion Redd in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR IN PERSON.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present. OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests that this matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court or in the alternative that it be set for status of counsel; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 16, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  nk

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Tyrail Deion Redd in court with attorney Edgar A Beltran.  Defendant Tyrail Deion Redd in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Tyrail Deion Redd appeared by video means with Attorney.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Tyrail Deion Redd
Current: 2901 N 29th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53210   (Effective: 06-26-2022)
Prior: 2903 West North Avenue, Milwaukee, WI 53208
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
